Western New England University’s Minor in Latin American Studies is an interdisciplinary program designed to give students a greater appreciation and understanding of the history, geography, politics, economy, and culture of Latin American countries and their peoples. Students examine a variety of topics, including globalization, democratization, social justice, human rights, environmental issues, and the impact of the United States on the region. The minor can be combined with any major, offering a distinct advantage in a globalized world where a knowledge of Latin America is increasingly important.

Designed to provide students with a general understanding of the American legal system, the Minor in Legal Studies is a great complement to a variety of majors, including Arts and Humanities, Business, Criminal Justice, Forensic Biology, History, Political Science, and more. A total of 18 credits are required for the minor. Students must complete Legal Studies 201 (Introduction to Legal Studies) and Legal Studies 301 (The American Legal System). Students choose an additional 12 credits (four courses) from a designated list of Legal Studies electives, with at least 6 credits (two courses) at the 300 level or higher. A minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0 in the minor is required.

Enhance your degree with a Management Minor. By pairing your major with the Management Minor, you will develop the managerial skills necessary to pursue supervisory and managerial positions in any field. Understanding the various aspects of business operations and organizational behavior are key to becoming an effective leader. You will take courses in accounting, marketing, and economics, in addition to courses in organizational behavior, leadership, and entrepreneurship.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International (The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business).

A Minor in Mathematical Sciences consists of 18 credits.

Any MATH course numbered 200 or above

Description:
Expand your career potential by adding a Minor in Mathematical Sciences to your academic program. With an increasing number of companies relying on data analysis and quantitative methods, individuals with strong mathematical skills are highly sought after across a wide range of industries.
The Department of Mathematical Sciences offers a minor in Mathematical Sciences for students of any major who are interested in enhancing their understanding of mathematical principles and gaining valuable analytical skills. This minor complements a wide array of majors, providing a solid foundation in areas such as calculus, differential equations, and linear algebra. The minor will help you develop your quantitative and critical thinking skills, preparing you for careers in fields such as finance, engineering, computer science, and data analytics.

Media influences every aspect of our lives, from the way we communicate to how we consume information and entertainment. Studying media empowers you with a critical understanding of its diverse forms, impacts, and ethical considerations, preparing you to navigate and shape this ever-evolving landscape.
The Minor in Media at Western New England University provides students with a foundational understanding of media theories, production, and critical analysis. Through a blend of theoretical coursework and practical application, students explore various media platforms, including digital, broadcast, and print, gaining skills in media literacy, content creation, and strategic communication. This interdisciplinary minor complements a wide range of majors, enhancing career prospects in fields such as marketing, public relations, journalism, film, and digital content creation.

Students interested in pursuing a minor in Music must complete 18 credits in Music, including: MUSC 100 Music Theory and Aural Skills I (3 credits), MUSC 110 Music Theory and Aural Skills II (3 credits), MUSC 210 Music History (3 credits), MUSC 310 World Music (3 credits), MUSC 410 Senior Project in Music (3 credits), and two Music electives (3 credits).

Neuroscience is an interdisciplinary field that studies the nervous system. The field combines biology, chemistry, and psychology to understand the structure, function, development, genetics, and pharmacology of the nervous system. The Minor in Neuroscience is ideal for students who wish to supplement their major with an interdisciplinary background in neuroscience to prepare them for careers or graduate study in fields such as health sciences, research, and biotechnology. Students will gain a fundamental understanding of the nervous system as well as its related physiological and psychological components.

For students seeking an understanding of the fundamental questions concerning existence, knowledge, values, reason, mind, and language, a minor in Philosophy is an excellent choice. This minor, available to students in any major, aims to cultivate skills in critical thinking, logical reasoning, and ethical analysis. Students will explore diverse philosophical traditions, examine the works of influential thinkers, and engage in rigorous discussions that challenge assumptions and broaden perspectives. Whether you're interested in pursuing a career in law, journalism, education, public policy, or simply want to enrich your personal and intellectual life, a minor in Philosophy provides a robust foundation for intellectual growth and personal development.

A minor in Political Science provides a broad overview of politics, including American politics, comparative politics, international relations, political theory, and public policy. The program develops critical thinking, research, and communication skills applicable to a variety of careers. The curriculum provides a strong foundation for students considering graduate study in political science, law, public administration, or international affairs, and is useful for students interested in careers in government, journalism, or non-profit organizations. Through the minor, students learn to analyze political issues, understand different political systems, and engage effectively in civic life.

A minor in psychology offers students in other fields a greater understanding of human thought and behavior. This understanding enhances virtually any undergraduate major, including those in the humanities, social sciences, natural sciences, and business. A minor in psychology also provides a foundation for students considering graduate study in psychology or related fields. Because Psychology is a field where a graduate degree is often needed to practice professionally, the minor in Psychology is designed as an introduction to this fascinating area and will enable students to develop a greater understanding of the human experience.

Public administration is a broad field of study covering the implementation of government policy and the academic study that prepares civil servants to work in the public service. As a public administration minor, you will learn about public policy, public budgeting and finance, personnel management, and public organizational theory, among other topics. This minor is an excellent complement to a variety of majors including political science, business, communications, and criminal justice, preparing students for careers in the public, private, and not-for-profit sectors.

Learn about the dynamic field of public relations with a Minor in Public Relations at Western New England University. This minor is an excellent complement to any major for students interested in developing their communication, writing, and strategic thinking skills. The Public Relations Minor provides students with a foundational understanding of public relations theory and practice, including media relations, crisis communication, social media, and campaign planning. Our curriculum emphasizes practical, hands-on experience, preparing students for careers in diverse sectors such as corporate, non-profit, government, and agency settings. Whether you aspire to be a spokesperson, a social media manager, or a strategic communicator, this minor will equip you with the essential tools to craft compelling messages and manage an organization's public image effectively.

The Minor in Quantitative Economics provides students with the opportunity to use economic analysis and quantitative skills in a variety of settings. The program introduces students to advanced statistical and econometric methods to analyze and interpret economic and business data. It provides excellent preparation for further study in economics, finance, data analytics, and business. The minor is suitable for students in a variety of majors, including economics, finance, business analytics and information management, mathematics, and actuarial science.

Statistics is the science of collecting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting data. Today's society generates immense quantities of data in nearly every field. Statistical techniques are used to extract information from data and to make sound decisions under uncertainty. The Minor in Statistics provides an introduction to the concepts and methods of statistics with applications across many disciplines. Students will learn methods for designing studies, summarizing and visualizing data, statistical inference, and mathematical modeling.

Theater at Western New England University includes courses in acting, history, stagecraft, and directing. Theater at Western New England University gives students the opportunity to learn a variety of performance techniques, as well as the history and theory behind theatrical productions. Through the Theater program, students will also be able to explore the techniques and skills needed in producing theatrical performances including set design, lighting, and costume production. Students will also be able to put their skills to use through the University’s extracurricular dramatic productions. This minor would be an excellent choice for a student who wants to supplement their major with an exploration into performance and dramatic literature, or who wants to improve their public speaking skills, or learn more about the technical aspects of performance.

Description: Occupational therapists are healthcare professionals who help people across the lifespan participate in the things they want and need to do through the therapeutic use of everyday activities (occupations). Common occupational therapy interventions include helping children with disabilities to participate fully in school and social situations, helping people recovering from injury to regain skills, and providing support for older adults experiencing physical and cognitive changes. Western New England University offers a unique 3+3 program for highly motivated high school students who wish to earn both a bachelor's degree (in Health Sciences) and a Doctor of Occupational Therapy (OTD) degree in just six years. This accelerated program helps you save a year of tuition, begin your career sooner, and position yourself for advanced opportunities. You’ll complete your bachelor’s degree in just three years and then seamlessly transition into the three-year OTD program. As an occupational therapy student at WNE, you will gain hands-on experience in clinical settings, develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills, and learn to provide client-centered care. Our graduates are highly sought after by employers and are prepared to make a positive impact on the lives of their clients.

Our innovative OTD curriculum incorporates principles of occupational justice into coursework and clinical experiences. In our small classes, you’ll learn from our distinguished faculty who have extensive experience as both researchers and practitioners. Description: The PhD in Behavior Analysis program is a full-time, campus-based program designed to train the next generation of leaders in the field of behavior analysis. Students will engage in advanced coursework in behavior analysis and develop a sophisticated repertoire of research and clinical skills. Students will contribute to the scholarly literature in behavior analysis through the completion of an empirical dissertation, and will complete a post-doctoral fellowship following coursework. The mission of the doctoral program in Behavior Analysis at Western New England University is to provide students with a rigorous course of study in behavior analysis that will prepare them for a career as a scientist-practitioner in the field. Graduates will be prepared to work in a variety of academic and clinical roles, and engage in research, teaching, and clinical practice. The doctoral program provides a stimulating and collegial learning environment, and opportunities for students to develop close working relationships with faculty mentors and with their peers. Students will work closely with their faculty mentors to design and implement a program of research in a selected area. In addition, students have a number of opportunities to gain supervised experience in teaching at the undergraduate and graduate level, and will have a variety of clinical experiences available to them at the University and in the community. The Association for Behavior Analysis International has verified the following courses toward the coursework requirements for eligibility to take the Board Certified Behavior Analyst® or Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst® examination. Applicants will need to meet additional requirements before they can be deemed eligible to take the examination.
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition scholarship and an annual stipend

Description: The Western New England University PhD in Engineering Management is designed for engineering and business professionals with STEM backgrounds who wish to conduct in-depth research to solve problems in complex engineering/technical systems. The curriculum offers a distinctive blend of qualitative and quantitative analysis, and a well-rounded business approach for managing technology, innovation, and people within an engineering or technical enterprise. While developing expertise as a world-class researcher, you will gain the skills and knowledge to lead organizations through complex technical and business challenges and bring a scholarly perspective and approach to your career in industry, research, or academia.

Description: Western New England University offers the only part-time PhD in Industrial Management in the United States, providing a unique pathway for working professionals to earn a terminal degree. This practice-oriented program is designed for industrial managers who seek to solve significant industry problems from an applied, interdisciplinary perspective. The program prepares students to become industry thought leaders, C-suite executives, and professors at teaching-oriented academic institutions. Our students are working professionals from a wide array of industries, including aerospace, healthcare, pharmaceuticals, manufacturing, and defense. This diversity leads to rich classroom experiences where students can share their real-world examples to enhance their learning. The PhD in Industrial Management degree is a STEM designated degree (CIP Code 15.1501). The program is not intended to be a distance learning program and requires in-person attendance.

Description: Our Juris Doctor (JD) degree is your gateway to a successful and satisfying legal career. The foundation of the JD curriculum is a rigorous program of required courses that provides students with a firm grounding in the core subjects of legal education. Building upon this foundation, students may choose from an extensive menu of elective courses to focus on particular areas of interest, including a variety of clinical and skills courses designed to ensure that they are 'practice ready' upon graduation. To earn the Juris Doctor degree, students must complete 89 credit hours of study and the Upper Level Writing Requirement. Our full-time program is typically completed in three years and our part-time programs in four years. The School of Law offers a variety of course scheduling options, including a full-time day program, a part-time day program, and a part-time evening program.
Accredidation: Western New England University School of Law is an ABA-approved law school.

Applicants must have official copies of their law school transcripts sent directly to the School of Law. Applicants must submit a personal statement of one to three pages. The personal statement should be a narrative that enables the Admissions Committee to learn more about the applicant and his/her motivation to pursue the LLM. Applicants should submit a current resume that includes their employment history and any other relevant activities, such as publications, and pro bono or community service. Letters of recommendation are not required, but are strongly encouraged.
Description: The Master of Laws (LL.M.) in Elder Law and Estate Planning is the preeminent program for attorneys who wish to gain sophistication in these two expanding areas of practice. Offered exclusively online, this 24-credit graduate program is designed for legal professionals to build expertise that will help them advance their careers and best serve their clients’ needs. The program is offered on a part-time basis, enabling busy professionals to balance work and family life while earning their advanced degree. All courses are offered completely online and can be accessed at any time of day, from anywhere. Our highly-regarded faculty of legal scholars are among the most accomplished and recognized leaders in their fields, with decades of practice and practical experience. Students will learn how to provide holistic, client-centered service, with a curriculum focused on the unique legal issues facing older adults and their families.
Accredidation: Western New England University School of Law is accredited by the American Bar Association (ABA) Council of the Section of Legal Education and Admissions to the Bar.

Description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming nearly every industry, from healthcare and finance to transportation and entertainment. As AI technology continues to advance, there is a growing demand for skilled professionals who can develop, implement, and manage AI systems. The Graduate Certificate in Artificial Intelligence from Western New England University is designed to provide you with the knowledge and skills needed to succeed in this dynamic field. In this program, you will learn the fundamentals of AI, including machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, and computer vision. You will also gain hands-on experience with popular AI tools and platforms, such as Python, TensorFlow, and PyTorch. The certificate program is designed to be flexible and can be completed online or in person. It is also a stackable credential that can be applied toward the MS in Electrical Engineering or the MS in Computer Engineering at WNE. With a graduate certificate in AI from WNE, you will be prepared for a variety of careers in the AI field, including AI engineer, machine learning engineer, data scientist, and AI research scientist. You will also be well-equipped to pursue further graduate studies in AI or a related field. With the skills and knowledge you gain, graduates of the AI graduate certificate program will be well-positioned to take on leadership roles in this exciting and rapidly growing field.

Description: Six Sigma is a disciplined, data-driven approach and methodology for eliminating defects in any process—from manufacturing to transactional and from product to service. The fundamental objective of the Six Sigma methodology is the implementation of a measurement-based strategy that focuses on process improvement and variation reduction through the application of Six Sigma improvement projects. This is accomplished through the use of two Six Sigma sub-methodologies: DMAIC (define, measure, analyze, improve, control) and DMADV (define, measure, analyze, design, verify). A Six Sigma Green Belt is an employee of a company who has been trained on the Six Sigma improvement methodology and will lead a process improvement team as part of their full-time job. Our 12-credit Green Belt Certificate program is ideal for business and industrial managers, engineers, supervisors, and others in positions of leadership or who aspire to leadership positions and who are interested in process improvement. You will gain a set of tools to improve quality in business organizations. Your studies will include topics in basic probability and statistics, statistical quality control, and the design of experiments. All courses are applicable toward the MS in Industrial Engineering or MS in Engineering Management.

This certificate may lead to the Certified Safety Professional (CSP) certification, which is the gold standard in safety certification.

It can be taken either as a standalone certificate or as a stepping-stone into the MS in Industrial Engineering program.
